attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCC8zXWnXUzinvvkxqo_description
attribs.current:
Make a token on http://rolladvantage.com/tokenstamp/ upload the token as your character image, and change the character name with this format:

PC Name (Game ID)

This is so the character can be assigned to you and a token can be made even while you are offline. if you fail to follow these instructions the character will eventually get deleted.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGp7l-ffnOMXmN5tmva_description
attribs.current:
You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose a fighting style from the list of optional features. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

Defense While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGp7l02qxEM6dmYOPoH_description
attribs.current:
You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level.

Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGpA068XXJz-G-nvTWm_description
attribs.current: Thanks to your orc blood, you have superior vision in dark and dim Conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in Darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in Darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGpBAtqfln2X1nrsHbM_description
attribs.current: When you are reduced to 0 Hit Points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a Long Rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGpBID9SD4S4Wus9nXh_description
attribs.current: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon Attack, you can roll one of the weapon’s damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LGpBv3jUkBAOpn8QmIS_itemcontent
attribs.current: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current: I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Live and Let Live. Ideals aren’t worth killing over or going to war for.

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: The monstrous enemy we faced in battle still leaves me quivering with fear.

attribs.name: repeating_proficiencies_-LGpGuBUyRBfmIsAw0Zg_name
attribs.current: Light Armor, Medium Armor, Heavy Armor, Shields

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LGpawzSmUgi1ZvdJIDI_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGpfmf1wSeZwO06KXlv_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On Your Turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action and a possible Bonus Action.

Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or Long Rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGpfu82cnq75xPIw4eW_description
attribs.current:
At 3rd level, you choose an archetype that you strive to emulate in your Combat styles and techniques, such as Champion. The archetype you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.
.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGphWfj8znlQXEUQCZR_description
attribs.current:
-Maneuvers
You learn three special maneuvers. You can use only one maneuver per attack.
You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice at 7th, 10th, and 15th level. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.
-Superiority Dice
You start with four superiority dice, which are d8s, and you expend one whenever you use a maneuver. You regain them all when you finish a short or long rest. 
You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level. 
-Saving Throws
Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows: Maneuver save DC: 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) DC:8+3+5=14

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGpjXcfalsx5RSamli6_description
attribs.current: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tool of your choice.

attribs.name: character_backstory
attribs.current:
Magnis had a "Normal" life. other then living in the city with his Human father and Orc Mother who both his parents were in the military. following in both there footsteps he joined at a young age. well he was a adult when he joined at the age of 17 but a majority of his job has been guarding small areas such as towns or small caravans. It bored him for the last 3 years and thought to himself "This is more boring then waiting for my parents on a hot summer day!" so he left to join the Eternal Sword Guild.
Even if he looks normal he does battle the thoughts of hurting people around him due to his Orc blood. He does his best to fight against the urge

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LH0wMLp5zkuIAZed5Ho_itemcontent
attribs.current: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

attribs.name: additional_feature_and_traits
attribs.current: A scar on his sword arm

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LH9OV0iRZCOFNdE0Umx_itemcontent
attribs.current: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LH9ioAvcoZgLTZfpiyQ_description
attribs.current:
Rally: On your turn, you can use a bonus action and expend one superiority die to bolster the resolve of one of your companions. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature gains temporary hit points equal to the superiority die roll + your Charisma modifier. 

Pushing Attack: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to drive the target back. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push the target up to 15 feet away from you.  

Commander's Strike: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks and use a bonus action to direct one of your companions to strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you and expend one superiority die. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack, adding the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

The number of attacks increases to three when you reach 11th level in this class and to four when you reach 20th level in this class.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHOEp14ZFpqfgdIjwkx_itemcontent
attribs.current: While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

attribs.current: Take an action analyzing a single enemy in combat. Next turn, if you hit this same target with an attack, treat one attack as if it were a critical strike. You may use this ability once per day. At level 10 you may use it twice per day. At level 15 you may use it thrice per day.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHe1El-1rhrZDefRJrx_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 7th level, if you spend 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside of combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics of your choice:

Strength score
Dexterity score
Constitution score
Armor Class
Current hit points
Total class levels (if any)
Fighter class levels (if any)

attribs.name: treasure
attribs.current:
Crafting an Item
A character who has the time, the money, and the needed tools can use downtime to craft armor, weapons, clothing, or other kinds of nonmagical gear.

Resources and Resolution. In addition to the appropriate tools for the item to be crafted, a character needs raw materials worth half of the item's selling cost. To determine how many workweeks it takes to create an item, divide its gold piece cost by 50. A character can complete multiple items in a workweek if the items' combined cost is 50 gp or lower. Items that cost more than 50 gp can be completed over longer periods of time, as long as the work in progress is stored in a safe location.
Multiple characters can combine their efforts. Divide the time needed to create an item by the number of characters working on it. Use your judgment when determining how many characters can collaborate on an item. A particularly tiny item, like a ring, might allow only one or two workers, whereas a large, complex item might allow four or more workers.

A character needs to be proficient with the tools needed to craft an item and have access to the appropriate equipment. Everyone who collaborates needs to have the appropriate tool proficiency. You need to make any judgment calls regarding whether a character has the correct equipment. The following table provides some examples.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LI4pnNyDsXIZuerUW7Z_atk_desc
attribs.current:
Target 1 creature within 20 feet. Make a ranged attack roll against this creature using your dexterity. You may add your proficiency if you are proficient with guns. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 fire damage from the explosion. All creatures in a 10 FT radius must make a DC15 dexterity saving throw, suffering 2d4 slashing damage on a failure. A failed save will also result in a bleeding wound, reducing the next healing they receive to half the normal amount
[x](https://media.giphy.com/media/4SXIUL2TH42SQ/giphy.gif)

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJUSV-PyjdP2DvU7G1S_description
attribs.current:
Beginning at 9th level, you can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a Long Rest.

You can use this feature twice between long rests starting at 13th level and three times between long rests starting at 17th level.
